column4: Which mirrors have the newer xorg package? How long does it take to roll out to all mirrors?
Is there a way to downgrade a package via apt/aptituse/synaptic which doesn't rely on you knowing the prvious version number?
try the same method as the xorg thing
just do the apt-cache policy for that package
or if its a single package browse with firefox or equivelant through the repos to the package u want
the apt-cache policy thing doesn't tell you the _previous_ version number
btw blend be careful with fuse // write support to ntfs
nothing in particular. But i have now had to downgrade 2 packages this week due to borked ubuntu repos. I'm getting bored trawling repos. A simple "apt-get downgrade" would be nice
